records.context_note: SIR 11780/2022 alleges that the Albanian authorities transported a migrant to the border with Greece and instructed him to cross it. The veracity of this allegation could not be established. Nonetheless, the allegation regarding the transport and instruction of the migrant by Albanian authorities to cross the border to Greece is consistent with similar events described in several other SIRs giving rise to concerns about the potential treatment of migrants by Albanian authorities.
records.evidence_quote: migrant was transported by the Albanian police to the Albanian - Greek border and was instructed to irregularly cross it.

records.location_details: near the border between Albania and Greece; BCU Kapshtice; Trestenik

records.location_text_raw: near the border between Albania and Greece

possible_violations.legal_basis: Article 4 of Protocol no. 4 of the European Convention on Human Rights

possible_violations.violation_name: prohibition of inhuman or degrading treatment
possible_violations.legal_basis: Article 3 of the European Convention on Human Rights

records.context_note: SIR 12332/2022 alleges that Albanian authorities transported a group of twelve migrants to the border and escorted them on foot until they crossed the border to Greece, while threatening the use of force. The veracity of this action was established and confirmed by the Albanian authorities, which have subsequently investigated and taken disciplinary measures against the four implicated police officers.
records.evidence_quote: Albanian authorities transported a group of twelve migrants to the border and escorted them on foot until they crossed the border to Greece, while threatening the use of force.

records.location_details: Albanian territory; detention centre; abandoned area 5 minutes' walk close to the BCP; Greece
records.uncertainty_note: Specific locations are redacted, making precise geocoding impossible.

records.context_note: FRO considers that the alleged facts could amount to serious breaches of the Frontex Code of Conduct and fundamental rights violations. Furthermore, FRO does not consider the information provided by the Albanian authorities to be sufficient to corroborate or refute the alleged facts of the case provided in the report.
records.evidence_quote: Albanian authorities brought them to an abandoned area [...] 5 minutes' walk close to the BCP, and then pushed him back to Greece.

records.context_note: While the Fundamental Rights Office was not able to conclusively establish the alleged facts raised in the present SIR, in particular allegations pertaining to a possible kick, the Office notes with concern the similarity of allegations to those in a number of SIRs about migrants being escorted to the border with Greece.
records.evidence_quote: an instance of potential use of excessive force by the Albanian officer in form of a kick.
